title: How to Delete Login Activity on Instagram: Mobile App & Web Browser

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. This app icon looks like a camera lens on a pink and purple gradient background. Log in if prompted. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. You'll see it in the bottom right corner of your screen. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This three-line menu icon is in the top right corner of your screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's usually the first option in the menu next to an icon of a gear.

steps.title: Tap Security.
steps.content: Tap Security . You'll see this next to an icon of a badge near the top of the menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Login activity.
steps.content: Tap Login activity . This is next to a map pin icon. [5] X Research source You'll see a history of your logins, including one labeled "Active now" that shows your current device.

steps.title: Tap ••• .
steps.content: Tap ••• . You'll see this three-dot menu icon to the right of your login activity as well as the location of the login and the device that was used. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Log out.
steps.content: Tap Log out . That device (whether a phone, tablet, or a computer browser) will be prompted to use a password the next time it attempts to log in. [7] X Research source That login will also be deleted from your login history. If you return to Settings > Security > Login activity , this session is no longer listed.

steps.title: Go to https://instagram.com in a web browser and log in if prompted.
steps.content: Go to https://instagram.com in a web browser and log in if prompted. You can use any desktop web browser to do this.

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. It's in the top right corner of your browser window and clicking it will prompt a menu to drop down.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . You'll see this near the bottom of the menu next to an icon of a gear.

steps.title: Click Login Activity.
steps.content: Click Login Activity . This is in the menu on the left side of the page. [8] X Research source You'll see a history of your logins, including one labeled "Active now" that shows your current device.

steps.title: Click next to a login that you want to delete.
steps.content: Click next to a login that you want to delete. It's the downwards-pointing arrow on the right side of the login's location and device.

steps.title: Click Log Out.
steps.content: Click Log Out . You'll see this under the map of the login's location. That device (whether a phone, tablet, or a computer browser) will be prompted to use a password the next time it attempts to log in. [9] X Research source That login will also be deleted from your login history. If you return to Settings > Security > Login activity , this session is no longer listed.
